snake-plant.name: Snake Plant
snake-plant.image_alt: Snake Plant lighting diagram showing placement options in a living room
snake-plant.description: Known for its striking upright leaves and air-purifying qualities, the Snake Plant is incredibly resilient and perfect for beginners.
snake-plant.watering: Water sparingly every 2-4 weeks, allowing soil to dry out completely between waterings. Tolerant of neglect.
snake-plant.sunlight: Prefers bright, indirect light but is highly adaptable to low light conditions.
facts: Are often found in offices because of they require low maintenance and often used by interior designers.

peace-lily.name: Peace Lily
peace-lily.image_alt: Peace lily lighting diagram showing placement options in a living room
peace-lily.description: Famous for its elegant white spathes (flowers) and glossy green leaves, the Peace Lily brings a sense of calm and tranquility.
peace-lily.watering: Keep soil consistently moist but not waterlogged. Water when the top inch feels dry. Likes humidity.
peace-lily.sunlight: Thrives in low to medium indirect light. Avoid direct sunlight which can scorch leaves.
facts: A popular house plant known for its elegant white flowers and lush green leaves, symbolizing peace, purity, and tranquility
A popular choice for gift-giving during times of mourning, as well as for decorating homes and office spaces

spider-plant.name: Spider Plant
spider-plant.image_alt: Spider plant lighting diagram showing placement options in a living room
spider-plant.description: Characterized by its arching leaves and numerous 'spiderettes' (baby plants), this plant is easy to care for and propagate.
spider-plant.watering: Water thoroughly when the top 1-2 inches of soil are dry. Reduce watering in winter.
spider-plant.sunlight: Best in moderate to bright indirect light. Can tolerate lower light but may grow slower.
facts: Are effective at removing common indoor pollutants like carbon monoxide.
Are known for being low-maintenance and can tolerate some neglect.

fiddle-leaf-fig.name: Fiddle-leaf Fig
fiddle-leaf-fig.image_alt: Fiddle Leaf lighting diagram showing placement options in a living room
fiddle-leaf-fig.description: A trendy plant with large, violin-shaped leaves that makes a bold statement. Can be a bit demanding but rewards with stunning foliage.
fiddle-leaf-fig.watering: Water when the top inch of soil is dry. Ensure good drainage and avoid overwatering. Likes consistency.
fiddle-leaf-fig.sunlight: Needs bright, filtered light, often near an east-facing window. Avoid direct sun and drafts.
facts: Are popular houseplants known for their large, violin-shaped leaves and ability to purify air
Considered a fickle plant, meaning they don't tolerate being moved or changes in their environment well.
